message.content:
{"id": "49890", "title": "Bug 49890: Nio Selector issue on Linux platform", "description": "Bug 49890: Nio Selector issue on Linux platform

Created attachment 25997 [details]: NioEndpoint.java and simple web application

Sometimes, the server's CPU reaches 100% and stays at 100% until the server is restarted. This issue has been reproduced with the following Java versions: 1.6.007, 1.6.018, 1.6.021. It seems to be a duplicate of issue Bug 46373. It appears that the Jetty team has fixed that problem, as mentioned in this comment on their JIRA issue: http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/JETTY937?focusedCommentId=168060&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:commenttabpanel.

I have added some logging to the NioEndpoint.java file.", "OB": "With this logging, we can observe that selector.select(timeout) sometimes returns zero keys on the Linux platform.", "EB": "The impact of this issue is a potential high CPU usage on Linux servers, which requires server restart to resolve.", "SR": "The issue has not been reproduced on the Windows platform.

Attached files:
- NioEndpoint.7z: Patched NioEndpoint.java (with logging)
- web.7z: Simple web application"}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '49890', 'title': 'Bug 49890Nio Selector issue on linux platform', 'description': "Bug 49890Nio Selector issue on linux platform Created attachment 25997 [details]NioEndpoint.java and simple web applicationsometimes ,server's cpu reaches 100%,and keep 100% all the time,until restartthe server.Reproduced with java versions: 1.6.007,1.6.018, 1.6.021.It is duplicate of issue: Bug 46373.It seams that Jetty guys fixed that problem: http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/JETTY937?focusedCommentId=168060&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:commenttabpanel.I added some logging to NioEndpoint.java. ", 'OB': 'With this logging we can see that selector.select(timeout) sometimes return zero keys on linux plutform. ', 'EB': '', 'SR': 'And it is never reproduced on windows platform.In the attach:NioEndpoint.7zpatched NioEndpoint.java (with logging)web.7zsimple web application. '}
